comments.body: I don't think this is fully correct. If someone did before `nthreads=1` (which meant: no additional threads), this will be translated into `use_threads=True`.
Although, maybe that is not really a problem since the default in pyarrow also actually changed from `nthreads=1` to `use_threads=True`

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +119,123 @@        return feather.read_feather(path, nthreads=int_use_threads)

    return feather.read_feather(path, use_threads=bool(use_threads))
